sentences.english: Look , I am very haleness! You are a enmity fetch among innumerability. Foolish and clumsiness are your epitaph.
sentences.chinese: 你是无数冤魂中的一个，愚蠢和笨拙是你的墓志铭。

sentences.english: He fumbled his one-handed attempt to light his cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 他笨拙地想用一只手点燃香烟。

sentences.english: Males may also be unsatisfied because of their own clumsiness and lack of experience.
sentences.chinese: 男性因为动作笨拙和缺乏经验，也可能会感到不满足。

sentences.english: But it has also demonstrated how clumsy Washington’s hand can be.
sentences.chinese: 但是它也展现了华盛顿之手是何等笨拙。

sentences.english: But why diminish all this with clunky dialogue?
sentences.chinese: 但是，为什么这部电影的对白确是笨拙？

sentences.english: The two thieves fumbled the door open.
sentences.chinese: 那两个贼笨拙地把门打开。

sentences.english: On land the turtle is ungainly , but in the water it is very agil.
sentences.chinese: 乌龟在陆地上很笨拙，但是在水里却很灵活。

sentences.english: The heart of overwork, and clumsy, you forgive him.
sentences.chinese: 心之过劳，人便笨拙，你原谅他吧。

sentences.english: You are a enmity fetch among innumerability . Foolish and clumsiness are your epitaph.
sentences.chinese: 你是无数冤魂中的一个，愚蠢和笨拙是你的墓志铭。

sentences.english: Mine was balky and awkward, brand new, and of a light, common color.
sentences.chinese: 我的却硕大笨拙，簇新，颜色浅而平凡。

sentences.english: A clumsy dog knocked the cup over.
sentences.chinese: 一条笨拙的狗将杯子弄翻了。

sentences.english: You got me trippin, stumbling, flippin, fumbling.
sentences.chinese: 你令我支吾，结巴，冒失，犯错，笨拙。

sentences.english: She's rejected in class because of he clumsiness.
sentences.chinese: 她因为行动笨拙而被班上同学排斥。

sentences.english: She said spitefully that Jem was the most clumsy genie in the whole school.
sentences.chinese: 她说，Jem在整个学校最笨拙的精灵说。

sentences.english: Her awkward attempt to explain her error merely added insult to injury.
sentences.chinese: 她笨拙地企图解释所犯的错误，结果只是越描越黑。

sentences.english: The electrician bungled the wiring job.
sentences.chinese: 电工笨拙地做接线工作。

definition: slow in one's reactions/sluggish (in movement or thought)
comical/funny/amusing/old pr. [gu3 ji1]/huaji, a form of comedy performance popular in Shanghai, Jiangsu and Zhejiang
to walk unsteadily/to stagger/to lurch/to hobble/to totter
to entail strenuous effort/to toil at a task/strenuous/laborious/strain
